diff_hunk:
@@ -591,7 +591,19 @@ def adaptive_avg_pool3d(input, output_size):
 
 
 # Activation functions
-def dropout(input, p=0.5, training=False, inplace=False):
+def dropout(input, p=0.5, training=True, inplace=False):
body: I agree that it is kind of goofy. If you don't pass a `train` parameter, functional dropout is always a no-op and there's no point in calling it. (I don't know what the BC breaking implications of this are though.)
